page.title: 14FOOTPATHS IN SOUTH ELKINGTON
page.content: The footpaths and bridleways on the definitive map were submitted by the Parish Council in 1949 in accordance with the Access to the Countryside Act.The present land owner welcomes their use.One follows a route from Welton-le-Wold,passes south of the village,crosses the Cow Pastures to Deighton Close and Louth.Others cross fields in the village,and there is a beautiful path through the Vale. The County Council have employed a Footpath Officer for 3 yrs.to liase with the landowners in order to identify the paths,to provide sign posts and stiles,and where possible to set up circular routes.The Wold scenery makes this area popular with ramblers,joggers,horse riders. A pedestrian's footpath runs beside the A631,from Deighton Close to South Elkington village.
